intro: Goniosperma vitiense, commonly known as the Vitiense Goniosperma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Oceania. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or wetland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
